intro: Aphelandra juninensis, commonly known as the Junín torchplant, is a species of flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It is characterized by its striking, pendulous inflorescences that bear bright yellow flowers, which are often used in ornamental horticulture. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in its natural habitat. Its leaves are elongated and glossy, with a dark green coloration. Aphelandra juninensis thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil for optimal growth.
